item.title: Understanding Servlet Mappings
item.description: Servlet Mappings Made Simple: A Beginner’s Guide Servlet mappings are a fundamental concept in Java web development. They define how requests from a web browser are directed to specific servlets on a server. Think of servlet mappings as traffic signs on a highwayâ€”they guide incoming requests to the right destination for processing. What is a Servlet? A servlet is a Java program that runs on a server and handles client requests. For example, it might process form data, interact with a database, or generate dynamic web pages.
